message: Perhaps you could also state what your aversion to Memcached is, so people have a better idea of what you're looking for in alternatives.
Been thinking about this and I think Redis is a good choice as a memcached replacement. However, I do have to agree with @ches and ask WTF is wrong with memcached?
Also anything that makes memcached restart will nuke your sessions.
If you use the same memcached for cache then you can't wipe your cache without logging users out. Of course we switched to redis for our caching and can now clear by regex which is fantastic.

I fear a lot of this will happen on convore. question asked and no follow up. :( not what worked for him. not why others didn't work. nothing at all.  hopefully other people are more willing to leave threads more useful for others that stumble upon them in the future
